capsules_submitted.utterance:
You know, I've always been fascinated by Harry's story. He's truly "The Boy Who Lived", and it's incredible to think about what he went through at Hogwarts. I mean, can you imagine being famous in the wizarding world just because you're a baby who survived a killing curse? It's no wonder he had to deal with so much pressure and scrutiny from a young age.

But despite all the challenges, Harry grew up to be an amazing wizard and an even more amazing person. I think what really sets him apart is his willingness to put himself in harm's way time and time again to protect others. He's just so brave and selfless, you know?
